msIdentifier.repository: Topkapı Palace Museum (Topkapı Sarayı Müzesi) , Istanbul

summary.p: 42 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: H. S. 186; Text: Q 3:129-Q 4:45; 8 lines per page; Dimensions: 210 x 150 mm; Script style: kūfī; Estimated date of production: 2nd (8th) to 3rd (9th) centuries [according to Karatay].

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 5: "15 H. S. 186 Kur’an’da[n] bir bölüm Parşömen. 150mm boy ve 210mm eninde 42 yaprak. Sahifede kûfî yaziyle 15mm uzunl.[uğunda] 8 satır. Tahminen II-III. asırda istinsah edilmiştir. Son yapraklarının bir kısmı yırtılmıştır. Bu parça Āl-i ʿİmrān (3) suresinin 129. ayeti ile başlar ve Nisa (4) suresinin 45. ayetinin başında biter."

This can be translated as follows: "15 H. S. 186 A part of the Qurʾān Parchment. 42 leaves of 150 mm height and 210 mm width. The text area written in Kufic script [contains] 8 lines measuring 15 mm. Probably copied during 2nd-3rd [(8th-9th)] centuries. Some of the last leaves are torn. The codex begins with Q 3:129 (Sūra Āl ʿImrān) and ends at the beginning of Q 4:45 (Sūra al-Nisāʾ)."
